column5: Hello everyone!  Been browsing these boards for awhile now, but have recently seen a couple threads about my hometown the Hammer.  So I thought what better time to join, say hello, and maybe make a few new fishing buddies in the process.  My name is Levi, I'm 26, born and raised in Hamilton, and have a passion for Bass fishing.  If anyone is from the Hamilton area and looking for someone to go bassin with at the harbour or surrounding area, let me know     (ps. no axe murderers )  cheers!

Welcome buddy !  Not from your area, but if your ever in the Chatham-kent area, drop me a line..... No pun intended.... well maybe a little ! hahah  This place is a good spot to come to, Im sure you'll love it !
Thanks for the warm welcome Lunker!  If I ever head to that area, I'll be sure to drop you a line and maybe you'll  put me on to some lunkers??
welcome to the board  axes are too labour intensified   so i use a chainsaw nowadays  ....thanks to the UMU ( Underground Murderers Union ) Local 666  Good Luck ( getting away)
Sorry ive been known to wield the axe now n then.  untill i see a report of someone landing 5 or 6 LM bass in an hour or two on these piers i'll stick to fishing outside the concrete jungle.
yeah to be honest I don't fish at the harbour,  but I'm not above it or anything, just have a lot of ponds in the area that produce, so I have no need to
I'll take my ruddy great axe over my chainsaw any day. Welcome to the demented zone  The harbour can have some interesting fishing.
welcome to the board cant wait to see some bass porn
Is that so? haha ive been eyeballing some areas that i think may produce some bass but the redhill express is going right thru it. what area of hamilton are you in?
west end..  Locke St. S..  you?
east end, parkdale s  the other end of the city lol
Welcome! Lots of fishing to do in and around the Hammer.
